duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide legal advice and counsel to senior management on a wide range of legal matters including individual giving, sponsorships, grants, agreements, and compliance.
Serve as a legal advisor on museum and education-related matters, with broad knowledge of New York not-for-profit and education law.
Support internal departments at the Museum on contractual arrangements, gift agreements, and various contracts.
Engage with outside counsel, when needed, to address legal matters on behalf of AMNH.
Draft, review, and negotiate a wide variety of contracts, including exhibition, loan, and specimen acquisition agreements, goods and services agreements, IT licenses, and copyright agreements.
Advise on non-profit governance, organizational documents, and compliance with State not-for-profit and education law.

education_certification.credential: J.D. (from an ABA-accredited law school) and state bar admission in New York or eligibility for immediate membership.
5+ years of experience in a law firm or combined with a complex not-for-profit institution.
Professional experience providing legal services to non-profit organizations, institutions of higher education, or cultural organizations is desirable.
